plugin.settings.title: OpenAI API Key
plugin.settings.description: Enter the API key for your OpenAI account

plugin.settings.title: Chat model to use
plugin.settings.description: OpenAI model to use (assuming you have access to the model you choose)

plugin.settings.title: How many key terms should be highlighted for one-click/follow-ups?
plugin.settings.description: This plugin will highlight the top N key terms in the response from ChatGPT. You can then click on the highlighted term to create a follow-up query digging deeper on that term. Set the number of terms to highlight here. The default is 5. Set this to zero to turn it off.

plugin.settings.title: Turn all key terms into clickable links for follow-up queries?
plugin.settings.description: If the number of key terms is >0 this setting determines whether all key terms are turned into follow-up links in the text or whether the key term links will just be listed beneath each chat response.

plugin.settings.title: How many related topics should be listed?
plugin.settings.description: If the number of key terms is >0 this setting determines whether all key terms are turned into follow-up links in the text or whether the key term links will just be listed beneath each chat response. The default is 5. Set this to zero to turn it off.

plugin.settings.title: Show Chat GPT Source + Date After answer
plugin.settings.OTHER:: choices: [array of options], boxHeight: set size of input box

plugin.settings.title: You Approve the Sending of Selected Content to OpenAI for Summarizing
plugin.settings.description: Generating an AI summary of a note requires the plugin to send the note you choose to OpenAI to be summarized. You will need to check this box (or approve the dialog box message) to confirm you are okay with this.

plugin.settings.title: Default Text Model
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired text AI model for non-chat (research) requests.

 - text-davinci-003: Most capable GPT-3 model. Can do any task the other models can do, often with higher quality, longer output and better instruction-following.

- text-curie-001: Very capable, but faster and lower cost than Davinci.

- text-babbage-001: Capable of straightforward tasks, very fast, and lower cost.

- text-ada-001: Capable of very simple tasks, usually the fastest model in the GPT-3 series, and lowest cost.

- ALL: Use with caution. Will generate using all of the primary models. Good for testing.

plugin.settings.title: Research Directory
plugin.settings.description: Select the desired directory to store generated research in.

plugin.settings.title: Target Summary Paragraphs
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired number of paragraphs to be generated with each summary.
Less than 3 is a good starting point.

plugin.settings.title: Target Key Terms
plugin.settings.description:
Select the desired number of key terms to be generated with each summary.
Less than 5 is a good starting point.

plugin.settings.title: Max Tokens
plugin.settings.description: Maximum amount of tokens any prompt can use.

plugin.settings.NOTE: DO NOT CHANGE THE FOLLOWING SETTINGS; ADD YOUR SETTINGS ABOVE ^^^

plugin.settings.title: Localization/Translation - translate each of these to your language of choice (if not English).
Initial Chat System Prompt
plugin.settings.description: This is the (required) text that is used to tell GPT how to respond to a basic chat request. The default text is: 'You are a helpful assistant. Please answer in English.'
plugin.settings.default: You are a helpful assistant. Please answer in English.

plugin.settings.title: Link title to continue chat
plugin.settings.description: Text to continue chat, default in English: continueChatText

plugin.settings.title: Summarize Note Prompt Text
plugin.settings.description:
This is the text that will be used to instruct GPT to summarize your note. Translate this to your language if you want to use a different language. The default in English is:
'Create a summary of the following text' (no punctuation at the end)
plugin.settings.default: Create a summary of the following text

plugin.settings.title: Summary Heading Text
plugin.settings.description:
When text is summarized, this is the text that will be used as the heading for the summary. Translate this to your language if you want to use a different language. The default in English is:
'Summary'

plugin.settings.title: Research Prompt Text
plugin.settings.description:
This is the text that is used to tell GPT what type of research to do and precisely how to format the response. That text will be replaced by the plugin when sending your request. Translate this to your language if you want to use a language other than English. Leave any text in {{brackets}} as-is and translate around it. The default prompt English is:
'Please provide a summary of {{subject}} in the following format:
List the top {{n}} key concepts associated with the subject and write a summary of the concept as it pertains to the subject in the following Markdown format.
Each concept should include a Wikipedia link.
The further reading links should be from Goodreads.com.
The first heading should be '# ${{subject}}'.
The second heading should be '## Key Concepts'.
For each Key Concept, the heading should be '### [key concept in brackets](Wikipedia link)' followed by a brief summary.
The fourth heading should be '#### Further Reading' followed by a Goodreads.com link for a recommended book on the topic.
plugin.settings.default:
Please provide a summary of {{subject}} in the following format:
List the top {{n}} key concepts associated with the subject and write a summary of the concept as it pertains to the subject in the following Markdown format.
Each concept should include a Wikipedia link.
The further reading links should be from Goodreads.com.
The first heading should be '# ${{subject}}'.
The second heading should be '## Key Concepts'.
For each Key Concept, the heading should be '### [key concept in brackets](Wikipedia link)' followed by a brief summary.
The fourth heading should be '#### Further Reading' followed by a Goodreads.com link for a recommended book on the topic.

plugin.settings.NOTE: DO NOT CHANGE THE FOLLOWING SETTINGS; ADD YOUR SETTINGS ABOVE ^^^

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description:
Set how much logging output will be displayed when executing AI commands in NotePlan Plugin Console Logs (NotePlan -> Help -> Plugin Console)

 - DEBUG: Show All Logs
 - INFO: Only Show Info, Warnings, and Errors
 - WARN: Only Show Errors or Warnings
 - ERROR: Only Show Errors
 - none: Don't show any logs

plugin.settings.title: Save Responses for Debugging
plugin.settings.description: Store JSON responses from OpenAI in a separate file for debugging
